day_1.theme: FOUNDATION - Introduction and Self as Instrument
day_1.emotional_arc: Excitement â†’ Concentration â†’ Discomfort â†’ Vulnerability â†’ Integration

Creates accountability structure from day one

schedule.purpose: Integration time, informal processing, relationship building

likely_content.reference: Timothy Gallwey: 'Coaching = unlocking potential for maximum effectiveness'

likely_content.topic: Google research: Good coach = #1 quality of best managers
likely_content.implication: Coaching as leadership style, not just separate role

preparation_recommendations: Think about own experiences being coached/mentored
Identify assumptions about what coaching is

schedule.note: First shared meal - important for cohort bonding

schedule.purpose: Orientation, sense of place, informal time

schedule.challenge_level: This is HEAVY content for Day 1

core_concepts_likely.relevance: Much of what happens in coaching happens below conscious awareness

core_concepts_likely.definition: Client projects feelings/patterns from past relationships onto coach
core_concepts_likely.coaching_application: Understanding why client may react strongly to coach
Using own feelings as diagnostic information

core_concepts_likely.definition: Attributing own unacknowledged feelings/thoughts to others
core_concepts_likely.coaching_application: Client may project onto team members, coach helps see this

core_concepts_likely.relevance: How people protect themselves from uncomfortable awareness
core_concepts_likely.coaching_application: Recognizing when client is defending vs. exploring

core_concepts_likely.definition: Dynamics in client's system show up in coaching relationship
core_concepts_likely.significance: Coaching relationship as microcosm of client's challenges

why_day_1: Establishes that coaching is about MORE than surface-level conversation
Prepares participants for depth of 'Self as instrument' exercise
Introduces complexity early - sets expectations for program rigor
Roger Lehmann's schedule may dictate timing
participant_experience_likely: Intellectual stretch - new vocabulary and concepts
Some confusion is normal and expected
May feel abstract until connected to practice
Provides framework for understanding own reactions later
preparation_recommendations: Read about basic psychodynamic concepts if available in pre-readings
Don't worry about understanding everything - focus on curiosity
Think about times you've had strong reactions to people at work

schedule.purpose: Essential processing time after heavy content
schedule.participant_need: Digest psychodynamic concepts before experiential work

structure_hypothesis.setup: Introduction to exercise, create safety, explain process
structure_hypothesis.small_groups: Split into 3-4 groups with executive coaches
process_likely: Personal reflection on self as instrument

core_inquiry: What do I bring to coaching relationship?
What are my strengths as an instrument?
How do my identity, background, values shape my coaching?
What triggers me? What hooks me?
How do I react under pressure?

connection_to_earlier_content.psychodynamic_approach: Now experiencing what transference/countertransference might feel like
connection_to_earlier_content.self_awareness: Making abstract concept concrete and personal
connection_to_earlier_content.coaching_definition: Understanding that WHO you are matters as much as WHAT you know

participant_experience_likely: Vulnerability - sharing in front of new colleagues
Insights about self that may be surprising
Beginning of cohort bonding through shared vulnerability
Fatigue - this is end of long first day
why_this_matters: Cannot coach others without knowing self
Awareness of own 'instrument' allows for calibration
Unconscious biases/patterns will affect coaching if unexamined
Sets foundation for all subsequent learning
preparation_recommendations: Reflect on: 'What makes me uniquely me?'
Consider: 'When do I perform at my best? When do I struggle?'
Embrace: This is meant to be challenging
Remember: Vulnerability = strength in learning environment

day_summary.pedagogical_logic: Concept â†’ Theory â†’ Experience | From head to heart
day_summary.emotional_journey: Welcome â†’ Structure â†’ Depth â†’ Vulnerability
day_summary.key_takeaway: Coaching requires deep self-knowledge, not just technique
day_summary.energy_management: Pace yourself - this is marathon, not sprint. Ends at 19:00 for a reason.

day_2.theme: SKILLS & ROOTS - Listening and Family Dynamics

purpose: Surface insights from 'self as instrument' work

structure_likely.format: Combination of individual reflection and group sharing
prompts_possible: What are you still wondering about?

schedule.unique_aspect: This is about HOW you reflect, not just WHAT you reflect on

likely_content.framework_possible: Descriptive â†’ Interpretive â†’ Critical reflection

likely_content.application: Both for own development and facilitating client reflection

likely_content.skill: How coach holds silence and allows client to go deeper

why_this_matters: Reflection is not just 'nice to have' - it's professional skill
Quality of coach's reflection = quality of development
Teaches participants to be more intentional about learning process
Sets up reflective practice for entire program
schedule.meta_insight: By reflecting on reflection, participants experience multi-level awareness - exactly what coaching requires

schedule.note: Photos for program materials - don't let this distract from learning focus

schedule.core_concept: Listening is THE most important coaching skill

levels_of_listening_likely.description: Focus on own thoughts, reactions, next question
levels_of_listening_likely.indicator: Thinking about what to say while client talks

levels_of_listening_likely.description: Complete attention on client - words, tone, body language
Awareness of client + environment + energy + intuition
levels_of_listening_likely.indicator: Notice what's NOT being said, sense atmosphere shifts
levels_of_listening_likely.coaching_impact: Deep insights emerge, client feels 'gotten' at profound level

schedule.practice_component: Likely includes dyad or triad exercises with immediate feedback
schedule.connection_to_day_1: Can't listen deeply to client if not aware of own internal noise (self as instrument)

schedule.note: Longer lunch - need integration time after skill-intensive morning

theoretical_foundation.core_idea: Family is primary system where we learn relationship patterns

theoretical_foundation.relevance: Leadership styles often mirror (or react against) family patterns

theoretical_foundation.coaching_relevance: These roles show up in organizational teams

theoretical_foundation.leadership_implications: First-born vs. middle vs. youngest patterns in leadership

why_explore_family_dynamics: Leadership behaviors rooted in family-of-origin experiences
Unexamined family patterns unconsciously influence coaching
Authority relationships in family â†’ authority relationships at work
Family communication patterns â†’ professional communication patterns

prompts: What messages did you get about success?
What was said about expressing emotions?
What were family rules about conflict?

likely_exercises.reflection: What role did you play? How does it show up now?

participant_experience_likely: Emotional activation - family is tender territory
Surprising connections between past and present
Grief, anger, or appreciation may surface
Deep bonding with cohort through shared humanity
coaching_applications: Recognizing when family patterns are at play in leadership challenges
Being aware of own family triggers when coaching
schedule.ethical_boundaries: This is coaching program, not therapy - family work serves professional development, not healing family wounds
preparation_recommendations: Reflect on family structure and key relationships before module
Consider: What did I learn about leadership from my family?

Know your boundaries: share what feels appropriate for professional context

day_3.theme: PRACTICE, PRACTICE, PRACTICE - Technique and Intensive Coaching

likely_questions: What's landing for you from yesterday's family work?
What did you notice about yourself in small group practice?

background.origin: Developed by Miller & Rollnick for addiction counseling
background.core_idea: Client has ambivalence; coach helps explore both sides

core_principles.application: Help client see gap between current state and values/goals
Don't argue against client's resistance - explore it
Believe in client's capacity to change

key_concepts.explanation: Client language that argues for (change talk) or against (sustain talk) change
key_concepts.coach_skill: Amplify change talk, explore sustain talk

key_concepts.explanation: Feeling two ways about something simultaneously
key_concepts.coaching_stance: Ambivalence is normal, not a problem to fix

examples: What are the good things about the current situation?
What are the less good things?
What would need to be different for you to consider changing?

why_in_coaching_context: Executives often ambivalent about changes they 'should' want
Supports autonomy - client decides, not coach
schedule.practice_component: Likely demonstration + structured practice in pairs
schedule.timing_significance: Teach concrete technique RIGHT BEFORE massive practice session - immediate application

schedule.purpose: Last break before next critical session

schedule.timing: Absolutely intentional - right before 5+ hours of coaching practice
why_now: By Day 3, participants feeling inadequacy: 'Can I really be a coach?'
About to practice intensively - imposter feelings will spike

imposter_syndrome_core.definition: Persistent doubt in one's abilities despite evidence of competence
imposter_syndrome_core.prevalence: Up to 70% of people experience this
coaching_relevance: Coaches feel it too - not just clients
Can interfere with coaching presence if unrecognized
Clients often experiencing it - coach must recognize and navigate

vulnerability_framework.core_message: Vulnerability is not weakness - it's courage
coaching_application: Cannot coach at depth without allowing own vulnerability
Client vulnerability requires coach to be comfortable with vulnerability
vulnerability_framework.professional_context: Difference between appropriate vulnerability and over-sharing

messages_to_participants: You are not expected to be expert coaches today
Making mistakes is part of learning
Uncertainty is not evidence of incompetence
Your willingness to try is what matters
The discomfort you feel = you're at your learning edge
preparation_for_practice: Shift mindset from 'perform perfectly' to 'experiment and learn'
Create permission for vulnerability in coaching practice
Anticipate and normalize the fears that will arise
schedule.strategic_brilliance: Addressing elephant in room BEFORE practice = participants can actually learn, not just manage anxiety

schedule.purpose: Final meal before intensive afternoon/evening practice
schedule.recommendation: Eat well but not heavily - long session ahead

roles.task: Bring real topic to be coached on

executive_coach_role: Teaches in real-time: 'Did you notice when...'

what_participants_practice: Contracting - establishing what to work on
Managing own anxiety while holding space
schedule.real_topics: Participants bring actual challenges - not role-play scenarios
emotional_landscape: After feedback: Calibration, seeing what works

schedule.note: Floating break - taken when group needs it, not fixed time

difference_from_session_1: More confident - first jitters worn off
Can take more risks in practice

schedule.likely_evolution: Groups developing own rhythm and culture

schedule.critical: Energy management - needed before final session

why_push_to_this_level: Breakthrough often happens when defenses are down from tiredness
Learn what it's like to coach when not at 100% (real-world)
Group cohesion deepens through shared intensity
Demonstrates commitment to practice, not just theory
Compression creates intensity that drives transformation
what_emerges_in_final_rounds: More authentic coaching - less trying to 'do it right'
Deeper trust = riskier, more real conversations
Coaching presence accessed naturally, not effortfully
Surprising insights for both coach and client
Embodied learning - coaching is in the bones now, not just head
executive_coach_interventions: May coach the coach mid-session (teaching tool)
Provide integrative feedback: 'Notice how far you've come today'
Help groups find completion even if tired

day_summary.pedagogical_logic: Technique â†’ Normalization â†’ IMMERSION â†’ Integration through repetition
why_this_design: Cannot learn coaching by talking about it - must do it
Fatigue strips away pretense - reveals authentic style
Participants leave KNOWING they can coach, not just hoping
day_summary.emotional_journey: Anxiety â†’ Technique â†’ Permission to be imperfect â†’ Practice â†’ Confidence building â†’ Fatigue â†’ Breakthrough â†’ Deep bonding
day_summary.key_takeaway: Coaching is a practice, not a performance. You CAN do this.
day_summary.energy_management: Early bedtime essential. No work emails. Let brain process.
day_summary.note_to_participants: This intensity is intentional. It's creating the container for real transformation. Trust the process.

schedule.timing_brilliance: After 3 days of intensive learning, NOW teach about learning itself

types: Pragmatist - learns by trying things out

why_now: Participants have just experienced 3 days of varied learning approaches
Can reflect on what worked best for them personally
Meta-awareness of learning = can optimize rest of program
Coaching application: understanding client learning styles
coaching_application: Match coaching approach to client's learning style
If client is activist - suggest experiments
If client is reflector - provide thinking space
If client is theorist - connect to frameworks
If client is pragmatist - focus on immediate application
personal_development_application: Design own learning for rest of program
Know how to get most from inter-module period
Understand own resistance to certain learning approaches
schedule.self_assessment_likely: Participants identify their own learning style preferences
schedule.meta_insight: By teaching this on Day 4, after experiencing multiple learning modalities, participants have data to work with

schedule.different_from_previous: This is NOT more coaching practice - creative group work

title_interpretation.accumulating_information: How insights accumulate over time, not forced
title_interpretation.deeper_meaning: Trusting the process, not controlling it

day_summary.pedagogical_logic: Reflection â†’ Meta-learning â†’ Creative integration â†’ Formal closure â†’ Informal celebration
day_summary.arc: Making sense â†’ Understanding how you learn â†’ Expressing learning creatively â†’ Setting next steps â†’ Celebrating together

day_4.outcome: Consolidated learning + Path forward + Cohort bonds

balance_of_modalities.rationale: Heavy emphasis on doing and reflecting, not just learning about

psychological_safety_building.day_1: Establishing container, sharing goals, first vulnerability (self as instrument)
psychological_safety_building.day_2: Small groups form, family sharing creates depth, trust building
psychological_safety_building.day_3: Intensive practice possible because safety established, imposter syndrome addressed
psychological_safety_building.day_4: Creative expression and celebration deepen bonds
psychological_safety_building.cumulative_effect: By end of module, cohort has shared significant vulnerability and formed strong bonds

intensity_management.pattern: Build â†’ Build â†’ Peak â†’ Integrate
intensity_management.recovery_built_in: Day 4 lighter, evening celebration, then week break before next module

individual_coaching_session.focus: Personal development goals identified in Module 1
individual_coaching_session.preparation: Reflect on Module 1 insights, identify what to work on

identity_map_completion.purpose: Deepen self-awareness, prepare for Module 2 work

design_brilliance.impact: Participants can actually learn instead of managing anxiety

design_brilliance.timing: After trust established, before intensive practice
design_brilliance.impact: Personal history informs coaching presence without overwhelming

design_brilliance.meta_skill: Teaching how to learn, not just what to learn

design_brilliance.intensity: Beyond comfort zone into transformation zone
design_brilliance.impact: Embodied confidence, not just intellectual understanding
Self-awareness with data, not abstract theory

design_brilliance.message: Learning should be joyful, not just hard work
design_brilliance.impact: Positive association with growth and challenge

potential_challenges.mitigation: Executive coaches present, Day 3 normalization session
potential_challenges.support_available: Individual coaching session in inter-module period

potential_challenges.mitigation: Intentional - transformation through intensity, Day 4 lighter
potential_challenges.participant_agency: Know this in advance, can prepare physically/mentally

potential_challenges.mitigation: Directly addressed in dedicated session, normalized throughout
Executive coaches skilled at facilitation, group agreements

intellectual: Review basic coaching definitions and frameworks
logistical: Book accommodation near campus if not local
Block Oct 23 evening completely (Day 3 goes late)

Prepare work delegation for intensive week
emotional: Journal on: 'What do I want to develop in myself?'

mental: Clear mental space - reduce decision fatigue
Identify one specific coaching skill to focus on

physical: Ensure adequate sleep - intensive week ahead

relational: Inform family/partners about intensive nature of week

immediately_after.rest: Full day off if possible - integration happens in rest
immediately_after.journaling: Capture hot insights before they fade
questions_to_reflect: What do I want to practice?

first_week_after.process: Let learning settle, don't force it

first_week_after.practice: One informal coaching conversation to apply learning
first_week_after.homework: Begin identity map while memories fresh

ongoing.connection: Stay in touch with cohort via Telegram
ongoing.coaching_session: Schedule individual session with executive coach

program_philosophy_evident: Learn by doing, not just listening
Integration is as important as acquisition
cultural_messages_embedded: Coaching is both art and science
You are the instrument - develop yourself
what_makes_this_excellent_design: Individual and group learning both present
Clear structure with room for emergence
Faculty are not just teachers but models
Bridge to next phase explicitly built

offer: Deep dive into specific topics (e.g., psychodynamic approach)
Set learning intentions with powerful questions

during_module.brief_checkins: Only if user initiates, keep very brief

after_module.action_planning: Support with homework and practice plan
